citeinfo.origin: Prince William Sound Nowcast-Forecast System (PWS NFS)
citeinfo.title: Prince William Sound Nowcast-Forecast System (PWS NFS)

abstract.p: The PWS NFS has both modeling and observational components, and utilizes both new and existing monitoring sites. The observational network includes 2 NDBC buoys, 3 NDBC C-MAN stations, 3 NOS tide gauge stations, 3 hydrographic stations, ADCP transects, satellite-tracked drifting buoys, and a GEM-EVOS sponsored ADCP mooring at Hinchinbrook Entrance. The observational network has recently been expanded to include 4 more meteorological stations. Additionally, sampling of nekton and plankton is carried out at various sites throughout the sound. Archived and near real-time data and model simulations will soon be publicly available on a web site.
Observations include water temperature, salinity, water level, tides, currents, plankton and nekton net surveys, wind speed/direction/gust, atmospheric pressure, air temperature, and dew point.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
